comments:
I20060117-0800

I found a lot of these in my log (with differing ids):

!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui.ide 4 4 2006-01-18 12:50:35.611
!MESSAGE Marker id: 1012046 not found.

!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.resources 4 376 2006-01-18 12:50:35.611
!MESSAGE Marker id: 1012046 not found.

I don't think it makes sense to write these messages to the log without providing a stacktrace.

Unfortunately, without a stack trace it is hard to tell who is logging these ;)

The message comes from a CoreException thrown by someone using IMarker, but the caller is evidently not logging the exception.
There are four occurrences of this code pattern in the MarkerView class, and one on line 196 of MarkerAdapter.
*** Bug 124650 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

I keep getting hundreds of these in I20060131-1200 and it's hard to tell what's going wrong. Upping severity, since that makes my flooded log fairly unusable.

These messages usually start shortly after I've switched the Problems view to grouped mode.
In I20060208-0848, I got into a state where Eclipse never stops printing out these messages. Raising severity.
Markus which grouping are you using? Do you use any filters?
I group by Java Problem Type, have a filter 'Default' which does not filter anything, and limit visible items per group to 200.
I have made John's suggested changes for build >20060208. I suspect it is the attribute testing that is the issue.

Got these stacktraces in I20060228-1207. Sorry, no steps - I only noticed them in the log now.

!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui.ide 4 4 2006-03-01 14:58:03.220
!MESSAGE Marker id: 1501619 not found.
!STACK 1
org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.ResourceException: Marker id: 1501619 not found.

Fixed in build >20060306. Now I do an exists check before I try and look up the attribute. I think this is an artifact of some of the categorization code using stale markers which should be fixed now.

Found 3 more cases in 20060308
